text: What does `<!DOCTYPE html>` declare?
explanation: <!DOCTYPE html> tells the browser this is an HTML5 document.

text: Which section of the HTML boilerplate contains visible content?
explanation: The <body> section contains all the visible content displayed in the browser.

text: What tag creates an unordered (bulleted) list?
explanation: <ul> creates an unordered list with bullet points.

text: What tag creates an ordered (numbered) list?
explanation: <ol> creates an ordered list with numbers.

text: Which tag is used for individual list items?
explanation: <li> (list item) is used inside <ul> or <ol> to define each list item.

text: What attribute specifies where a link goes?
explanation: The href attribute in an <a> tag specifies the URL or path the link points to.

text: How do you open a link in a new browser tab?
explanation: Adding target="_blank" to an anchor tag opens the link in a new tab.

text: Which attribute is REQUIRED for an `` tag?
explanation: The src attribute is required - it specifies the path or URL to the image file.

text: What is the purpose of the `alt` attribute in images?
explanation: Alt text describes the image for screen readers and displays if the image fails to load.

text: What goes in the `<head>` section?
explanation: The <head> contains metadata, the page title, links to stylesheets, and other non-visible information.

text: What is the correct nesting order?
explanation: Elements must close in reverse order - the last element opened should be the first closed.

text: What does `<meta charset="UTF-8">` specify?
explanation: Charset UTF-8 tells the browser how to encode characters, supporting most world languages.

text: Why is `index.html` a special filename?
options: Servers automatically serve it as the default page
explanation: Web servers automatically serve index.html when visitors access a directory without specifying a file.

text: What is the correct syntax for an email link?
explanation: Use href="mailto:email@address.com" to create an email link.

text: Can you nest a list inside another list?
options: Yes, by placing a <ul> or <ol> inside an <li>
Only ordered lists can be nested
Only unordered lists can be nested
explanation: Lists can be nested by placing a new <ul> or <ol> inside an <li> element.
